text: Any news on being able to use our own base templates in the D&D editor?
is there any way to get the social sharing module in the new email editor?
i only see the "follow me" social module
Hi Steven! No major news at the moment. Out of interest can you share the type of template (or "features") that you're looking to build out in the DnD editor?

Hi Stefen! Not at the moment, but that's actually a semi-intentional thing. Generally speaking we see almost zero engagement on that module type, far more on the follow me social module which is why we prioritised that over sharing. Do you generally see a lot of engagement on the sharing module in emails you send out?
i can't answer that question since i don't send out emails haha. A client was wondering about it
i think i can create a custom module to replicate the functionality so it shouldn't be too much of a problem

Sure!

I have a template called main.html which contains

head section
CSS
meta
an `@import` for global variables
opening code structure
`{% block body_bg %}{% endblock %}`
a few editable modules
closing code structure

------

I have two templates (these are the target templates when coding a new template) depending on the type of email - I have blue or white which vary slightly in structure and this contains -

`{% extends "/Email/Layouts/main.html" %}`
Specific HTML
`{% block modules %}{% endblock %}`

------

Finally I have the email templates themselves which extend either the blue or white template as well as containing all the modules that make up the template.

------

So what in the D&D manager, what I'd like to be able to do is to choose either the blue or white template (as these are the target templates), then drag in as many modules as necessary.
I'm happy to screenshot or do a short video to show you more
